sections.title: Section 1: K-means Clustering Concepts and Procedure

questions.question: What is the main assumption about the shape of clusters in K-means clustering?
Which distance metric is typically used in K-means clustering to assign points to clusters?
**(Hard) ** What are some limitations of K-means clustering?

options.B: Can be unstable due to random initialization
options.C: Can get stuck in local minima

questions.question: What is the first step in the K-means clustering algorithm?
What does the elbow method help determine in K-means clustering?

sections.title: Section 2: Evaluating K-means and Clustering Metrics

questions.question: **(Hard) ** Which metrics can be used to evaluate K-means clustering quality?
What does a silhouette score close to -1 indicate for a data point?

options.A: The point is well-matched to its assigned cluster
options.D: The point is closer to another cluster than its own

questions.question: What is a potential issue when using K-means with high-dimensional unstructured data?

options.A: It always finds the global minimum
options.B: It may get stuck in a local minimum due to many peaks and valleys in the loss function
options.D: It works best with categorical data

sections.title: Section 3: HDBSCAN Clustering Concepts and Comparison

options.A: Hierarchical Density-Based Spatial Clustering of Applications with Noise
options.B: High-Dimensional Bayesian Spatial Clustering Algorithm with Noise
options.C: Hierarchical Data-Based Statistical Clustering Analysis with Noise
options.D: Hybrid Density-Based Spatial Clustering Algorithm with Noise

questions.question: **(Hard) ** What are advantages of HDBSCAN over K-means?

options.A: Does not require specifying the number of clusters
options.B: Can handle clusters of varying densities
options.D: Allows for more or less granular clustering
